Title:
Psychronectria hyperantarctica gen. comb. nov.,
epitypification and phylogenetic position of a pathogenic Antarctic
bryophilous ascomycete
Keywords:
Nectriaceae, moss related fungus, taxonomy, Thyronectria,
Tilachlidiaceae
Abstract:
The holotype of Thyronectria hyperantarctica (D. Hawksw.)
D. Hawksw. & Spooner has been re-examined, re-described and compared
with new isolate of Antarctic bryophilous ascomycete. Since the
condition of type material was not sufficient for molecular studies, the
new isolate from similar area was used to designate an epitype with
herbarium material. Phylogenetic analysis of this epitype material
revealed its closest relationship with Tilachlidiaceae family. However,
it is forming separate lineage within this group. Therefore, a monotypic
genus Psychronectria is newly proposed to accommodate the new
combination P. hyperantarctica. The characters that distinguish
Psychronectria from other morphologically and phylogenetically related
genera are discussed.
